question.text: Which among the following is the most crucial step of the Calvin cycle?

solution.text: Calvin cycle occurs in stroma of chloroplast in which fixation of  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  to form glucose occurs. In this the most crucial step is carboxylation in which gaseous  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  is trapped by plants mediated by enzyme RuBisCO and initial  <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>  acceptor is  <math><mn>5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> .
